node.title: This couple made it through a year of COVID-19 separation. Now they're marking a romantic milestone
node.alt: Angelica, wearing a flowing midi dress, and David, wearing a black shirt and fedora, dancing and smiling in a park.
node.description: The pandemic has made David and Angelica's long-distance relationship harder. However, after a year apart, they are reuniting and marking a romantic milestone.
node.content:
["David Waldie and his fiancee, Angelica Maffey-Stumpe, are a couple very much in love.", "Walking together, they hold hands tightly because\u00a0they have not\u00a0seen each other for almost a year due to the pandemic.", "But this reunion is extra special\u00a0because, in 2022, the Queensland couple will mark 10 years of being engaged.", "\"We'll celebrate with a nice, romantic dinner together or something, won't we sweetheart?\" asked David, as he smiled at Angelica and squeezed her hand.", "", "
David and Angelica live more than 1,700 kilometres apart.(ABC News: Alice Pavlovic)
", "Reunited in David's hometown of Brisbane for Christmas, the couple \u2014 who both live with Down syndrome \u2014 have made up for lost time and enjoyed long walks and talking about their shared interests of singing and movies.", "\"I think all the stars have aligned for us,\" David said about finally being together.", "\"I kept saying Santa Claus\u00a0has brought my fiancee as a Christmas present.\"", "", "
Angelica and David say they have loved each other for a long time.(ABC News: Alice Pavlovic)
", "Angelica lives in Port Douglas, in Far North Queensland, and the risks of COVID-19 have made travel difficult over the past year.", "\"I love David very much,\" Angelica said.", "\"I've missed him, but we phoned most nights and chatted.\"", "While the pandemic has made their long-distance relationship harder, the couple is sharing their story to show that they're not defined by their disability, but by their strength of character and love for each other, which they say can overcome anything.", "
A strong relationship over many years
", "David and Angelica first met more than 30 years ago through their mothers: Mary Waldie and Selina Maffey.", "The women connected because they had young children with Down syndrome. David was a toddler and Angelica\u00a0a seven-month-old baby.", "Ms Maffey said the connection between the two children was immediate.", "\"When David and Angelica met, from the very beginning for them personally, there was an instant acknowledgement of each other,\" Ms Maffey said.", "", "
David and Angelica are in no rush to get married.(ABC News: Alice Pavlovic)
", "The family tells the story of how David, as a toddler, brought his face close to baby Angelica's and said \"boo\" and made her jump \u2014\u00a0and they \"became friends forever\".", "Over the years, the women visited each other with their children and found they had similar attitudes to life and love.", "\"Love is love,\" Ms Waldie said.", "\"Every relationship is special and different.\"", "
No need to rush marriage
", "It was at David's mother's 50th birthday party in 2004, where the couple realised they were more than friends.", "\"I was at high school still and I hadn't seen David for a long time,\" Angelica said.", "\"We hung out together and I fell in love with him.\"", "", "
David said he proposed to Angelica \"the old, traditional way\", by asking her father's permission.(ABC News: Alice Pavlovic)
", "In 2012, David decided to ask Angelica to marry him, the \"old, traditional way\".", "\"I asked her Dad, for his approval to marry my girlfriend, Angelica,\" David said.", "\"I said yes and David bought me a lovely ring,\" Angelica said.", "The couple is understandably proud of their long history.", "", "
David and Angelica are looking forward to planning their wedding.(ABC News: Alice Pavlovic)
", "\"We have always loved each other since day dot,\" David said.", "\"We are very happy with our lives and I reckon it's good for people to know that they don't have to rush into marriage.", "\"Building our independence and skills has been important [during their engagement],\" Angelica said.", "
Love grows over long engagement
", "For 15 years, Angelica has worked as a guest service attendant at a five-star hotel in Port Douglas.", "David, 36, is a professional singer-songwriter, actor and dancer, based in Brisbane.", "They both live independently but speak to their mothers every day and have a close relationship with each other's family.", "\"Whenever we are ready to [get married], we will always let our families know,\" David said.", "With the couple's relationship now spanning 16 years, Ms Waldie said her son and Angelica had \"grown and matured together\".", "\"I'm very proud of the effort and work that they put into their lives with living independently and also into their relationship,\" Ms Waldie said.", "", "
Mary Waldie, right,\u00a0says communication has been key to\u00a0the long relationship.(ABC News: Alice Pavlovic)
", "Ms Maffey said she was pleased her daughter and David had not rushed into getting married.", "\"What's happened over this period of time is that their love has grown, and Mary and I have grown in understanding what it is that David and Angelica genuinely want and helping to facilitate that,\" Ms Maffey said.", "Ten years into their engagement, David and Angelica couldn't be clearer about their feelings for each other.", "\"I love my fiancee David,\" Angelica declared.", "", "
The reunion in Brisbane is the first time David and Angelica have seen each other in more than a year.(ABC News: Alice Pavlovic)
", "They sit together holding hands and encouraging each other as they respond to the ABC's questions.", "\"Angelica is the most beautiful person in the world and I wouldn't change anything about her, even though she does have Down syndrome, and that's the best thing about her for me,\" David said.", "\"If we had to choose a song to describe our relationship, it would be Ed Sheeran's 'Perfect'.\""]
